result.title: Protocols Handbook for chemical characterization and preparatory techniques.
result.description: Besides previous approaches conducted by consortium members PHM SZN and MATIS will guide the preparation of standardized methods on sample processing and sharing This is crucial since samples from cultures clones or pool of clones and any extractsfractions containing traces of siderophore or surfactant activity need to be properly standardized to ensure the good progress of the project This will ultimately lead the development of a Handbook for chemical characterization and preparatory techniques D21 on month M6 and is closely related to deliverables envisaged in Tasks 5154 The Handbook will be revised and updated within WP5 activities

result.title: Protocols Handbook of screening procedures for extremophilic microorganisms
result.description: PHM ADL LUND MATIS USE and SZN will work together on the development of a standardized screening pipeline which will be applied to evaluate the potential of all the project microbial collections for the production of bioactive molecules This will allow the reproducibility of the results in the biodiscovery of new biosurfactants and siderophores A single deliverable D22 on month M6 will be achieved by reporting a Protocols Handbook of screening procedures for marine and extremophilic microorganisms

result.title: Project website and social media presence
result.description: The website will contain a brief presentation of the project goals and objectives along with a brief description of the consortium and the implemented work strategy It will serve as the major source of information for the public regarding updates achievements and activitiesAs a result the website will be continuously updated with any relevant updateSocial media accounts for the direct promotion of SECRETed will be set up These accounts will be active in both professional networks eg LinkedIn and publicsocial networks eg Facebook Twitter enabling the projects communication to be as broad as possible Active and continuous online presence can be ensured with the social media accounts providing direct measurements on the interested audience and its engagement rate

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: Describes how data required for the project will be managed and curated COMPASS will provide open access OA to research outputs eg publications data models material and components design etc through deposition in trusted repositories and digital tools for well simulator and decisionsupport accessible for geothermal communities through a webbases solution In fact partners will provide OA to peerreviewed scientific publications relating to their results The authors of all peerreviewed scientific publications will choose the most appropriate way of publishing their results and these publications will be stored in an OA trusted repository during and after the projects life The consortium will be encouraged to publish in the httpsopenresearcheuropeeceuropaeu platform

result.title: The potential spill over effect of the project
result.description: The effect our project can have for other geothermal applications will be addressed, including the effect on conventional geothermal production. Through literature review and research, we will address how our technology and methods can improve geothermal well design as there are numerous issues regarding well integrity. Moreover, we will also look at the potential broader use of these methods, for instance in adapted oil and gas wells, to investigate the full range of environments, where our technology and methods can be useful.

result.title: KPI definition for cladding and cementing validation
result.description: To ensure a successful well design, KPIs related to cladding and cementing performance will be formalised with the assistance of the advisory board. This will be a live document, updated as the project progresses and new KPIs added if required. These KPIs will be used to validate the cladding and cement solutions in a credible scientific manner for work in WP3 and WP4 along with validation activities in WP6.
